definitions.definition: To affect one's mind by using extreme mental pressure or any other mind-affecting process. (e.g. hypnosis )
To take from an electronically controlled machine its stored-up information; to erase a computer's programming. (1960)

examples: The news media brainwashed many people.

main_definition: ( psychology ) To affect one's mind by using extreme mental pressure or any other mind-affecting process. (e.g. hypnosis )
secondary_definitions: ( figuratively , dated ) To take from an electronically controlled machine its stored-up information; to erase a computer's programming. (1960)
